title: Update paywall message and premium payment UI redesign

requirements.text: In the PaywallModal component (frontend/src/components/PaywallModal.tsx), replace the existing informational/disclaimer message with the following exact text: 'Payments are verified manually for this beta launch. Please enter correct UPI Transaction ID. Invalid entries may result in access revocation.' Display this message prominently within the payment section, styled to convey trust and seriousness (e.g., using a distinct info/warning style box with an icon such as a shield or info symbol).

quotes: Change the payment message to: "Payments are verified manually for this beta launch. Please enter correct UPI Transaction ID. Invalid entries may result in access revocation."

acceptanceCriteria: The paywall modal displays the exact message: 'Payments are verified manually for this beta launch. Please enter correct UPI Transaction ID. Invalid entries may result in access revocation.'
No old disclaimer or message text remains in its place.
The message is visually distinct (e.g., inside a styled notice box with an icon) and easy to read.

requirements.text: Redesign the PaywallModal component (frontend/src/components/PaywallModal.tsx) to appear more premium and trustworthy. The redesign must include: (1) a refined card layout with a dark or deep-gradient background (e.g., deep navy, dark slate, or rich charcoal) contrasted with bright accent colors from the existing Gen-Z palette for CTAs; (2) a prominent trust badge or shield icon near the headline to signal security; (3) the UPI ID displayed in a styled, clearly readable block (e.g., monospace font in a highlighted pill or box); (4) the QR code / payment instruction area given a dedicated framed section with padding and a subtle border; (5) the transaction ID input field styled with a clear, premium look â€” larger padding, visible focus ring, and a descriptive label; (6) the 'Verify & Unlock' button styled as a high-contrast, gradient CTA button with a lock or checkmark icon; (7) subtle dividers between payment steps to guide the user through the flow. All existing functional behavior (submitting transaction ID, calling backend, error handling) must remain unchanged.

quotes: Make the payment section look more premium and trustworthy.

acceptanceCriteria: The paywall modal uses a premium visual style (dark/deep gradient background or rich card styling) that clearly differs from the general app background.
A shield or security icon is visible near the modal headline.
The UPI ID is displayed in a clearly styled block (e.S., monospace pill or highlighted box).
The 'Verify & Unlock' button uses a high-contrast gradient with an icon (lock or checkmark).
The transaction ID input has generous padding, a visible focus state, and a descriptive label.
All existing functional logic (submit transaction ID, success/error states, backend call) continues to work correctly.
The redesigned modal is mobile-responsive and fits within the max-width constraint of ~800px.

constraints: Do not alter any backend logic or data structures.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui.
All existing paywall functional behavior (submitTransactionId mutation, success/error handling, unlock state reload) must remain intact.
nonGoals: Changing the UPI ID value or payment amount.
Modifying any page other than the PaywallModal component.
